Throughout his life, he lived in several places around the county: Northdown in Margate on Apr 2, 1871; at Drapers Cottage in Margate on Apr 5, 1891; at 15 Haine Cottages, St Lawrence, Thanet on Mar 31, 1901; on Elder Cottage, 23 Northdown Road, St Peters, Thanet on Apr 2, 1911 (when he was living with his mother, Elizabeth Ann) following the death of his wife on Jun 7, 1909; and at Sacketts Hill Farm, St Peters, Thanet on Jun 19, 1921. Charles In 1921 he was working at George Phippott Farmer on Buddles Farm, Dane Court Road, Broadstairs, Kent, England.

He died on Jan 20, 1929 in Broadstairs, Kent (myocarditis and enlarged prostate) and was buried in St Peters after Jan 20, 1929.

Throughout his life, he lived in several places around the county: at Pansy Cottage, Way, Minster in Thanet on Jun 19, 1921; at Way Cottages, Minster in Thanet on Aug 28, 1931 and on Sep 29, 1939; on 22 Molineux Road, Minster in Thanet in 1955 and in 1959; at 19 Kingston Avenue, Garlinge in 1965 and in 1971; and at 33 Fulham Avenue, Garlinge in 1974.

Edmund appeared in 4 newspapers: in Kentish Express on 28 Aug 1931 on page 003 (https://www.findmypast.com/image-viewer?issue=BL/0003535/19310828&page=0003&article=054&stringtohighlight=frank%20horne), in an unknown newspaper on 21 Oct 1997 (https://www.findmypast.com/image-viewer?issue=BL/0002514/19971021&page=0019&article=019&stringtohighlight=edmund%20frank%20horne), in an unknown newspaper on 12 Nov 1997 (https://www.findmypast.com/image-viewer?issue=BL%2F0003797%2F19971112&page=40&article=040&stringtohighlight=edmund+frank+horne) and in an unknown newspaper on 13 Oct 1998 (https://www.findmypast.com/image-viewer?issue=BL/0002514/19981013&page=0023&article=023&stringtohighlight=edmund%20frank%20horne).

He served in the army from 1939 to 1945 in Dunkirk, Kent, England (the Buffs (East Kent Regiment)).

He died on Oct 12, 1997 at Wisdom Hospice, High Bank, Rochester, Kent (cancer) and was buried on Minster Cemetery, Tothill Street, Minster in Thanet on Oct 20, 1997 following his funeral at St Mary the Virgin Church.

parents.name: Abraham Mount

parents.bio:
The child of Richard Stuple and Elizabeth EasonIsaac Stuple, the 3 times great-grandfather of Nigel Horne, was born in Herne, Kent, England in 17991,2,3, was baptized there on May 2, 1800 and also married Ann Mount (with whom he had 5 children: Abraham, Thomas, Jane, James and Emily) there, on Oct 13, 1830.

Throughout his life, he lived at his birthplace in 18511 and in 18612.

He died in Apr/may/jun 1870 in Herne Bay, Kent, England3.
parents.name: Isaac Stuple
Richard Stuple
parents.bio: Richard Stuple was the 4 times great-grandfather of Nigel Horne and married Elizabeth Eason (with whom he had 1 child, Isaac) at St. Mary's, Reculver, Kent, England on Oct 12, 17991 (Widow).

parents.name: Elizabeth Stuple (née Eason)
parents.bio:
Elizabeth Eason, the 4 times great-grandmother of Nigel Horne, was born in 17591,2 and married Richard Stuple (with whom she had 1 child, Isaac) at St. Mary's, Reculver, Kent, England on Oct 12, 17993 (Widow).

She died in 1833 in Herne, Kent1 and was buried there at St Martin on Apr 14, 18334.

parents.name: John Mount
parents.bio: John Mount was the 5 times great-grandfather of Nigel Horne and married Margaret Lamb (with whom he had 11 children: Thomas, Isaac, William, Mary, Alice, Ann M, John, James, Mary, Maria and Margaret) in Monkton, Kent, England on Feb 15, 17721. In 1772, he lived in St Nicholas-at-Wade, Kent which is where he died in 1818. He was buried there on May 13, 1818 (KFHS CD17).
John Lamb was the 6 times great-grandfather of Nigel Horne and married Mary Lawrence (with whom he had 1 child, Margaret) in Ash, Kent, England on Sep 30, 1746 (KFHS CD 33).
parents.name: John Lamb
Mary Lamb (née Lawrence)
parents.bio: Mary Lawrence was the 6 times great-grandmother of Nigel Horne and married John Lamb (with whom she had 1 child, Margaret) in Ash, Kent, England on Sep 30, 1746 (KFHS CD 33).

The child of John Lamb and Mary LawrenceMargaret Lamb, the 5 times great-grandmother of Nigel Horne, was born in Ash, Kent, England c. 1745, was baptized there on Aug 16, 1752 and married John Mount (with whom she had 11 children: Thomas, Isaac, William, Mary, Alice, Ann M, John, James, Mary, Maria and Margaret) in Monkton, Kent, England on Feb 15, 17721.

She died in Jan 1822 in St Nicholas-at-Wade, Kent and was buried there on Jan 10, 1822 (KFHS CD17Aged 77).
parents.name: Margaret Mount (née Lamb)

parents.bio:
An agricultural laborer and the child of John Mount and Margaret LambThomas Mount, the 4 times great-grandfather of Nigel Horne, was born in St Nicholas-at-Wade, Kent, England in 17741,2,3, was baptized there on Dec 18, 1774 and married Mary Buxey (with whom he had 3 children: Elizabeth, Ann and Thomas) in Herne, Kent, England on Nov 4, 17975 (archiver.rootsweb.com KFHS CD21).

Throughout his life, he lived in Herne in 18517; and at Blean Union Workhouse in Herne on Mar 30, 18518.

He died on Aug 23, 1851 Blean Union Workhouse in Herne4 and was buried at St Martin in Herne on Aug 26, 18516.
parents.name: Thomas Mount
Mary Mount (née Buxey)
parents.bio:
Mary Buxey, the 4 times great-grandmother of Nigel Horne, was born in Herne Bay, Kent, England in 17791,2 and married Thomas Mount (an agricultural laborer with whom she had 3 children: Elizabeth, Ann and Thomas) in Herne, Kent, England on Nov 4, 17975 (archiver.rootsweb.com KFHS CD21).

Throughout her life, she lived in Herne in 17976, in 18411 and in 18512.

She died in 1858 in Kent3,4 (jun/Jul) and was buried in Herne on Jul 5, 18584.

The child of Thomas Mount and Mary BuxeyAnn Mount, the 3 times great-grandmother of Nigel Horne, was born in Sturry, Kent, England c. 18041,2,3,4,5 and married Isaac Stuple (with whom she had 5 children: Abraham, Thomas, Jane, James and Emily) in Herne, Kent, England on Oct 13, 1830.

Ann spent all of her life in Kent, England. Throughout her life, she lived in Herne in 18511 (the same place as her mother had been living in 1797), in 18612 (the same place as her father had been living in 1851) and in 18713; and Blean Union Workhouse in Herne on Apr 3, 18814 which is where she died in 18825 (oct/Nov/Dec).
parents.name: Ann Stuple (née Mount)

parents.bio:
George Colyer, the 3 times great-grandfather of Nigel Horne, was born in Hackington, Kent, England c. 1812 and married Dorcas Belsey (with whom he had 1 child, Mary Ann) at Ss Cosmus & Damian, Blean, Kent, England on Mar 23, 18333.

He died in 1859 in Blean1,2 (jan/Feb/Mar) and was buried in Hackington on Mar 6, 18592.
parents.name: George Colyer
William Belsey
parents.bio: William Belsey was the 4 times great-grandfather of Nigel Horne and had 8 children with Anne: William, Mary Anne, Sarah, James, Charles, Edward, Dorcas and Emma.

parents.name: Anne Belsey
parents.bio: Anne was the 4 times great-grandmother of Nigel Horne and had 8 children with William Belsey (a laborer): William, Mary Anne, Sarah, James, Charles, Edward, Dorcas and Emma.

The child of William Belsey and AnneDorcas Belsey, the 3 times great-grandmother of Nigel Horne, was born c. 1813, was baptized in Ickham, Kent, England on Sep 12, 1813 and married George Colyer (an agricultural laborer with whom she had 1 child, Mary Ann) at Ss Cosmus & Damian, Blean, Kent, England on Mar 23, 18332.

She died c. 1835 in Kent1 and was buried in Hackington, Kent on Apr 7, 1835 (age 22 on burial record)1.
parents.name: Dorcas Colyer (née Belsey)
Mary Mount (née Colyer)
parents.bio:
A charwoman and the child of George Colyer and Dorcas BelseyMary Colyer, the great-great-grandmother of Nigel Horne, was born in Herne, Kent, England c. 18321,2,3,4,5,6, was baptized in Blean, Kent, England on Jul 13, 1833 and married Abraham Mount (a mariner with whom she had 5 children: William, Elizabeth Ann, Edwin Henry, Mary A and Walter Charles, along with 1 surviving child) in Herne Bay, Kent, England on Oct 22, 18598 (Registry office).

Throughout her life, Mary lived in several places: on Salts Lane in Herne Bay on Apr 2, 18719; in Eddington, Kent on Apr 3, 188110; at 2 Salts Lane in Herne Bay on Apr 5, 18913; on 372 Merton Road, Wandsworth, London, England on Mar 31, 19014, when she was living with her son William, following the death of her husband on May 12, 1897; in hospital at Mitcham Workhouse, Holborn, London from Jun 16, 1903 to Jul 22, 1903; in hospital from Oct 11, 1904 to Dec 20, 1904; and in hospital on Tooting Bec Asylum, Church Lane, Tooting Common, London on Sep 7, 1906 and on Apr 2, 191112.

She died on Mar 21, 1920 at 164 St. John's Hill, Wandsworth, London, England7 (cardis Vascular degeneration).

parents.name: Elizabeth Lawrence (née Mount)
parents.bio:
A domestic servant and the daughter of Abraham Mount and Mary ColyerElizabeth Mount, the great-grandmother of Nigel Horne, was born in Herne Bay, Kent, England on Oct 13, 1860, was baptized there at Christ Church on Nov 25, 1860 and married James Lawrence (an agricultural laborer with whom she had 6 children: Edward James S, William John, Emily Jane, Walter Charles, Elizabeth Annie and James Thomas, along with 1 surviving child) at Ebenezer Chapel, Meeting Street, Ramsgate, Kent, England on Dec 10, 1882.

Throughout her life, Elizabeth lived in several places: on Salts Lane in Herne Bay on Apr 2, 1871; on Edith Villa, Edith Road, St Lawrence, Thanet, Kent on Apr 3, 1881; and at 10 Claremont Gardens in Ramsgate on Apr 5, 1891.

She died on Jul 12, 1898 on Seaman's Infirmary, West Cliff Road in Ramsgate (pre-eclampsia followed by a coma).

The daughter of James Cowell and Emily LawrenceJoyce Cowell, the mother of Nigel Horne, was born in Minster, Thanet, Kent, England on Feb 12, 1931, was baptized there at St Mary the Virgin Church on Apr 5, 1931 was married twice - to (on Nov 1, 1952 in Minster) (c. May 1976 in Sittingbourne, Kent, England). She had 4 children with Edmund Horne: David James, Diane Joyce, Nigel John and David James.

Joyce spent all of her life in Kent, England. Throughout her life, she lived in several places around the county: at 7 Pouces Cottages, Minster, Thanet on Sep 29, 1939; on 22 Molineux Road, Minster, Thanet in 1955 and in 1959; at 19 Kingston Avenue, Garlinge in 1965 and in 1971; at 33 Fulham Avenue, Garlinge in 1974; and at 20 Melbourne Avenue, Ramsgate in 2022.

She died on Nov 10, 2022 on Queen Elizabeth the Queen Mother Hospital, Ramsgate Road, Margate, Kent (pneumonia) and was buried on Minster Cemetery, Tothill Street, Minster, Thanet, Kent on Jan 19, 2023 following her funeral at St Mary the Virgin Church.
parents.name: Joyce Soper (née Cowell)
